result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel A. Colon

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(8:58 AM cases 08CM1457, 15CM361, 20CF87 called.) Defendant Joel A. Colon appeared by video. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Joel A. Colon. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Attorney Thorson advises has dated offers and doesn't have a formal offer yet.
State notes the defendant has waived jury trial right to all cases in July 2021.
State also notes there was an offer provided in 2021 once right to jury trials were waived. State notes has resent the offer to Attorney Thorson via email and Attorney Thorson advises he received.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Status Conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 1:30 pm in person.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on March 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on January 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on November 12, 2021 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on November 12, 2021 at 11:00 am.

03:30 PM Cases Called: 08CM1457, 15CM361 & 20CF87. Defendant Joel A. Colon in court with Attorney Robert Thorson.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. There is a jury trial set for 08/16/21 for 2 days. There is a new offer that has been extended. Defendant is willing to waive his right to a jury trial in all three cases. Court has colloquy with defendant and determines that defendant is waiving his right to a jury trial freely, voluntarily and knowingly, with the advice of counsel. Court finds that defendant waives his right to a jury trial in all 3 cases. State has no objection to the jury trials being waived. Jury trial can be removed from the calendar. Parties to contact JA for scheduling.
Status conference on July 22, 2021 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on April 26, 2021 at 02:00 pm.

09:35 AM Cases 20CF87, 15CM361, and 08CF87 held via Zoom. 
Defendant Joel A. Colon did not appear. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared via video. Attorney Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense advises he spoke to his client yesterday and may have given the defendant the wrong Zoom Meeting Information. Defense asks for more time to file motions. 
Court grants parties 30 days from today to file any motions. Defense and State to schedule a motion hearing with Branch 1 judicial assistant.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Robert Thorson
Status conference on January 11, 2021 at 09:30 am.

8:30am Hearing held via Zoom. 08CM1457 & 15CM361 Defendant Joel Colon appeared via video. Attorney John Bachman appeared via video. Attorney Sean Froelich appeared via video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting new counsel. Court grants Defendant's request as this is the first appointment by the Public Defender's office. Attorney Bachman to contact the PD office so that new counsel is appointed. STC: 01/11/2021 at 9am
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2021 at 08:30 am.

(Cases 08CM1457 and 15CM361 are called at 10:34 AM- all parties for this hearing appear via Zoom) Defendant Joel A. Colon appears. Attorney John Charles Bachman appears separately. Attorney Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs more time to discuss elements of offenses and rights given up. 
Plea and Sentencing Hearing: 01/04/2021 at 8:30 AM.
Plea hearing on December 14, 2020 at 10:30 am.

Prior: 3136 W. 40th St, Cleveland, OH 44109

(Cases 08CM1457, 15CM361, 20CF87 are called at 01:30 PM- all parties for this hearing appear via Zoom) Defendant Joel A. Colon appears. Attorney John Charles Bachman appears separately. Attorney Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. Defense indicates there is an agreement on cases 08CM1457 and 15CM361 but needs more time to complete paperwork. Defense requests a Status Conference and Jury Trial be scheduled in 20CF87. 
Court advises counsel to schedule Plea Hearing in 08CM1457 and 15CM361 and a Status Conference and Jury Trial in 20CF87 with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Status conference on November 24, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

(Cases 08CM1457, 15CM361, and 20CF87 are called at 10:48 AM- all parties for this hearing appear via Zoom) Defendant Joel A. Colon does not appear. Attorney John Bachman appears. Attorney Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance- has had contact with Defendant recently. State requests warrant. 
Court orders warrant effective 12/30/2020 at 12:00 PM.
Status conference on November 24, 2020 at 10:45 am.

Modified Condition:
Defendant is allowed to leave Wisconsin.

Conditions Remaining in Effect: 
No contact with M.H., P.H. or residences.

(Covers  08CM1457, 15CM361 & 20CF87)
Approving request to amend the bond to allow the Defendant to leave Wisconsin. All other conditions of bond remain in force.

Proposed Order for Bond Modification

Conditions:

Defendant is not leave the State of Wisconsin.

Status conference on September 28, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with M.H., P.H. or residences.
Defendant is not leave the State of Wisconsin.
(Covers  08CM1457, 15CM361 & 20CF87)

(Cases 08CM1457, 15CM361, 20CF87 called at 08:33 AM- all parties for this hearing appear via Zoom) Defendant Joel A. Colon appears in custody. Attorney John Charles Bachman appears. Attorney Bradley W Novreske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is no agreement at this time, waives reading of the Informations in 08CM1457, 15CM361, 20CF87 and pleads not guilty to all counts in 08CM1457, 15CM361, 20CF87. Court accepts not guilty pleas. 
Status Conference: 9/28/2020 at 3:30 PM. 
Defense motions to modify cash bond amount. State objects to any modification of bond. Court orders $3,000 cash bond to cover all cases, new condition: Defendant is not leave the State of Wisconsin- all other previously ordered conditions remain until further order of the Court. Defendant to updates his address before his release from jail.
Arraignment on August 20, 2020 at 08:30 am.
dated 8/14/20 from ADA Bradley Novreske to Court objecting to the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond and requesting a hearing be scheduled.

August 11, 2020, Judge Theisen lowered Mr. Colons bond in 20CF87 from
$5,000 cash to $2,000 cash. However, he did not modify Mr. Colons bond in this
case. The bond remains at $5,000 cash. Mr. Colon moves the court for an order
equalizing the cash bond in all his cases.

Conditions:
No contact with M.H., P.H. or residences.
(Covers 15CM361 & 08CM1457)

Cases called at 2:02 PM: 08CM1457, 15CM361 and 20CF87. All parties appeared via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Joel A. Colon appeared in custody from the jail.  Attorney John Charles Bachman appeared via telephone. Attorney Bradley W Novreske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to personal appearance.  20CF87: State calls Sgt Jeff Baumgarten of the Altoona Police Department-He is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Defense Attorney John Bachman.
Re-Direct by State. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 1 to schedule ARGN with 08CM1457 and 15CM361 to ride along.
Defense filed motion to modify bond from $5,000 Cash to $2,000 Cash bond (Defendant will live with a relative in Abbotsford, WI and will have employment and transportation to Court). 
State objects and notes that all 3 cases (08CM1457, 15CM361 and 20CF87) are covered under the $5,000 Cash Bond.
Court modifies only 20CF87 to a $2,000 Cash Bond with the same conditions. Counsel to file motions to amend bond in 08CM1457 and 15CM1361.
SPD Appointment - Attorney John Bachman

records.addlTxt: filed by John Bachman
Hearing on August 11, 2020 at 02:00 pm.

(11:08 AM cases 08CM1457, 15CM361 and 20CF87 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. Defendant Joel A. Colon in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail via video with Attorney Dailey Johnson. Attorney Crystal Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant updates address with the Court. Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Warrants are quashed.
State requests $10,000.00 cash bond to cover all cases, citing warrant issued since October and the length the oldest case has been pending. Defense objects and requests a signature bond or $400.00 cash bond at most.
Preliminary Hearing: 08/11/2020 at 2 PM scheduled for 20CF87 and cases 15CM361 and 08CM1457 to ride along.

Conditions:
No contact with M.H., P.H. or residences.
(Covers 20CF87, 15CM361, & 08CM1457)
